data.question: What is the chemical formula for BIF-20?
What is the space group of BIF-21?
At what temperature were the diffraction data for BIFs collected?
What is the estimated initial isosteric heat of H2 adsorption for BIF-20?
What is the purpose of using KBH(mim)3 in the synthesis of BIF-20?
data.answer: KBH(mim)3 is used as a precursor for the boron imidazolate framework in the synthesis of BIF-20.

data.question: Why does BIF-20 exhibit high H2 uptake capacity?
data.answer: BIF-20 exhibits high H2 uptake capacity due to its unusual 3-connected tetrahedral framework with debonded α and β cages.

data.question: Is the framework of BIF-20 stable up to 350 °C?
Does BIF-21 have a higher framework density (T/V) than BIF-20?
Is the synthesis of BIF-20 performed at room temperature?
Are the crystals of BIF-20 soluble in water?
Does BIF-20 have a neutral framework?
Is the CO2 uptake of BIF-20 higher at 298 K than at 273 K?
What is the role of the obb ligand in the structure of BIF-20?
data.answer: The obb ligand serves as the charge balancing agent and the strut between the β-cages in BIF-20.

data.question: What is the vertex symbol of the 3-connected net in BIF-20?
What is the effective hexagonal window size of the channel in BIF-20?
What is the maximum pore volume of desolvated BIF-20 as determined by the Horvath–Kawazoe equation?
What is the significance of the 3-coordinate centers in BIF-20?
data.answer: The 3-coordinate centers in BIF-20 are significant for enhancing gas uptake capacity and promoting catalytic activity.

data.question: Is the synthesis of BIF-21 similar to that of BIF-20?
What distinguishes BIF-20 and BIF-21 in terms of their structural topologies?
data.answer: BIF-20 and BIF-21 have distinct topologies based on the use of different charge balancing auxiliary ligands.

data.question: What is the main goal of the research presented in the article?
data.answer: The main goal is to develop a new strategy for the design of interrupted zeolite-type metal organic frameworks.
